Two equal parallel chords are drawn $ 8$ inches apart in a circle of radius $ 8$ inches. The area of that part of the circle that lies between the chords is:\\
\\
$ \textbf{(A)}\ 21\frac {1}{3}\pi - 32\sqrt {3} \qquad\textbf{(B)}\ 32\sqrt {3} + 21\frac {1}{3}\pi \qquad\textbf{(C)}\ 32\sqrt {3} + 42\frac {2}{3}\pi$\\
$ \textbf{(D)}\ 16\sqrt {3} + 42\frac {2}{3}\pi \qquad\textbf{(E)}\ 42\frac {2}{3}\pi$
